issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description: Opening this to note a specific failure while attempting to import a windows image/instance. Errors are report "Invalid access key or token". Could the credentials expired? The result is the task fails and is canceled, but in this case the 13G volume remains attached to instance. The volume is owned by the user who initiated the import-instance conversion task, but that user is not authorized to detach the volume from the service instance, and can not delete or use the volume. The eucalyptus/admin user needs to fetch the volume with using the 'verbose' flag and/or detach the volume to delete or return use of the volume to the owner. Thanks, -M {code} 2016-06-29 03:44:43,784 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task 2016-06-29 03:45:44,906 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task 2016-06-29 03:45:45,433 worker [DEBUG]:(None, fields.summary: import task failure due to invalid access key or token

comments.body: [~mclark], from your log it look like worker asked service to give a new task before finishing prev task. Could it be that you had two worker processes running at the same.

[~vasya] 
It's possible. I hadn't logged into this VM before so it would have had to of spawned a 2nd (or more) on it own?
Thanks,
-M

[~mclark], worker should not have two processes running.
This part of the log worries me:
{code}
2016-06-29 04:07:26,908 worker [DEBUG]:(import-i-1f265be5) Status { "status": { "bytes_downloaded":10989076480 } }, bytes transferred: 10989076480
2016-06-29 04:07:27,493 worker [INFO]:Querying for new imaging task
2016-06-29 04:07:28,421 worker [DEBUG]:(import-i-1f265be5) Status { "status": { "bytes_downloaded":10999562240 } }, bytes transferred: 10999562240
{code}
